intro: Xysmalobium crispum, commonly known as the curly leaved larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers and finely dissected, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats at high elevations. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes other showy and sometimes toxic plants. Xysmalobium crispum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
